description: Shapes better outputs by specifying boundaries like format, length, tone, audience, or exclusions. Surface when user asks for creative or open-ended output without specifying format, length, tone, or audience, or when the request could reasonably go many directions. Satisfied when user defines boundaries using phrases like: keep it, no more than, in the style of, for [audience], avoid, don't include, format as, make it [adjective].
detail: Constraints aren't limitationsâ€”they're creative fuel. Telling Claude the format, length, tone, audience, or what to avoid focuses the response dramatically. The more specific your boundaries, the less Claude has to guess.
